snippet: As capital punishment erodes in the Northeast and other parts of the country, its status as a Southern phenomenon has intensified.
abstract: Opponents of the death penalty see Connecticut's decision to abolish the death penalty as part of a larger trend but not a major shift in the nation's thinking; as capital punishment erodes in the Northeast and other parts of the country, it remains well-rooted in the South.
lead_paragraph: As capital punishment erodes in the Northeast and other parts of the country, its status as a Southern phenomenon has intensified.

headline.seo: Death Penalty Critics Don’t See Nationwide Shift in Connecticut Vote
headline.main: In Connecticut Vote, Death Penalty Critics Don’t See Major Shift
headline.print_headline: In Connecticut Vote, Death Penalty Critics Don’t See Major Shift
